text:
Stating that imported cigarettes are sold to children in shops located near schools in the city, Bharatiya Janata Party district unit has demanded action to curb the sale and also prevent students from getting addicted to such habits.

In a petition to Corporation Commissioner K.R. Selvaraj, district president N. Annadurai and district general secretary R.P. Gopinath said that imported cigarettes in different flavours are sold in petty shops near schools and students are getting addicted to it.

The petition said that tobacco products manufactured in India carry pictorial warning message that sometimes discourage the consumers to buy the products. But the imported cigarette packets do not have such warning messages nor price or the manufacturing area.
title: BJP demand
